sen.j: 百円硬貨（ひゃくえんこうか）は、日本政府発行の補助硬貨。
sen.e: The 100-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
The 100-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
The 100-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.

sen.j: 百円玉（ひゃくえんだま）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called 'hyaku en koka' or 'hyaku en dama' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 「百円硬貨」、「百円玉」をローマ字で併記しました。
sen.e: It is called 'hyaku en koka' or 'hyaku en dama' in Japanese.
It is called 'hyaku en koka' or 'hyaku en dama' in Japanese.

sen.j: 造幣局 (日本)では便宜上年号の記された面を「裏」としているが、明治時代の硬貨と異なり法律上、百円硬貨に表裏はない。
sen.e: Japan Mint defines that the side on which the year is marked is the tail for convenience sake, but unlike coins in the Meiji period, 100-yen coin legally has no head or tail.
The Japan Mint defines that the side on which the year is marked is the tail side for convenience sake, however, unlike coins from the Meiji period, the 100-yen coin legally has no head or tail.
The Japan Mint defines that the side on which the year is marked is the tail side for convenience sake, however, unlike coins from the Meiji period, the 100-yen coin legally has no head or tail.

sen.j: 百円白銅貨
sen.e: 100-yen cupronickel coin
The 100-yen cupronickel coin
The 100-yen cupronickel coin

sen.j: 現在発行されている百円硬貨。
sen.e: 100-yen coin that is currently issued.
This is the 100-yen coin that is currently issued.
This is the 100-yen coin that is currently issued.

sen.j: 表面には「日本国」と「百円」そしてサクラが、裏面には「100」と製造年がデザインされている。
sen.e: On the head side are designed 'Japan' and '100 yen' (both in kanji) and Japanese cherries, and on the tail side the number '100' and the year of manufacture.
On the head side are the designs for 'Japan', '100 yen' (both in kanji) and Japanese cherries, and on the tail side is the number '100' and the year of manufacture.
On the head side are the designs for 'Japan', '100 yen' (both in kanji) and Japanese cherries, and on the tail side is the number '100' and the year of manufacture.

sen.j: 側面にはギザギザが103個ある。
sen.e: On the lateral side, there are 103 knurls.
On the lateral side, there are 103 knurls.
On the lateral side, there are 103 knurls.

sen.j: 「100」の文字は現行五十円硬貨の「50」と類似したデザインが用いられている。
sen.e: For the letters '100,' a design similar to the letters '50' on current 50-yen coin is used.
For the character for '100,' a design similar to the character for '50' on current 50-yen coin is used.
For the character for '100,' a design similar to the character for '50' on current 50-yen coin is used.

sen.j: 百円銀貨
sen.e: 100-yen silver coin
The 100-yen silver coin
The 100-yen silver coin

sen.j: 1957年に戦後初めての銀貨として鳳凰を意匠とする100円銀貨が発行された。
sen.e: In 1957, 100-yen silver coin was issued designing hoo (a mythological sacred bird in Chinese lore, a phoenix) as the first silver coin after the war.
In 1957, the 100-yen silver coin was issued with the design of a "Hoo" (a mythological sacred bird in Chinese lore, a phoenix) as the first silver coin minted after the war.
In 1957, the 100-yen silver coin was issued with the design of a "Hoo" (a mythological sacred bird in Chinese lore, a phoenix) as the first silver coin minted after the war.

sen.j: このときの製造原価は43円であるとされた。
sen.e: The cost of manufacturing at that time was said to be 43 yen.
The cost of manufacturing at that time was said to be 43 yen.
The cost of manufacturing at that time was said to be 43 yen.

sen.j: 1959年には量目・品位をそのままに、デザインが稲穂に変更された。
sen.e: In 1959, the design was changed to ears of rice while the weight and composition were unchanged.
In 1959, the design was changed to ears of rice while the weight and composition were unchanged.
In 1959, the design was changed to ears of rice while the weight and composition were unchanged.

sen.j: なお、この際に五十円硬貨もデザインが変更となり、デザインはともに一般公募された。
sen.e: At the same time, the design of 50-yen coin was also changed and both designs were sought from the public.
At the same time, the design of the 50-yen coin was also changed and both designs were sought from the public.
At the same time, the design of the 50-yen coin was also changed and both designs were sought from the public.

sen.j: これら2種の100円銀貨の品位は.600である。
sen.e: The compositions of these two types of 100-yen silver coins were.600.
The compositions of these two types of 100-yen silver coins were.600.
The content of silver in these two types of 100-yen silver coins is 0.600.
sen.cmt: Ｇ欄コメントに従って書き換えました。

sen.j: 2008年時点での銀相場は1グラムあたり50円程度で推移している。
sen.e: As of 2008, silver quotation hovers around 50 yen per gram.
As of 2008, the value of silver hovers around 50 yen per gram.
As of 2008, the value of silver hovers around 50 yen per gram.

sen.j: 仮に50円とした場合の百円銀貨に含まれる銀の価格は (50x4.8x0.6)144円となり額面金額を超える。
sen.e: Assuming it is 50 yen, the price of silver contained in a 100-yen silver coin is (50x4.8x0.6) 144 yen, which exceeds the face value.
Assuming it is 50 yen, the price of silver contained in a 100-yen silver coin is (50x4.8x0.6) 144 yen, which exceeds the face value.
Assuming it is 50 yen, the price of silver contained in a 100-yen silver coin is (50x4.8x0.6) 144 yen, which exceeds the face value.

sen.j: 今後銀相場がさらに高くなった場合、違法な貨幣損傷等取締法行為の対象にされる恐れが潜在的にある。
sen.e: If the silver quotation goes even higher, there is a potential risk that the coin becomes subject of illegal acts against Act on Control of Damaging and Other Acts Related to Coins.
If the value of silver were to go even higher, there is a potential risk that the coin will become subject to illegal acts against the Act on Control of Damaging and Other Acts Related to Coins.

sen.j: 日本の銀貨も参照
sen.e: Also refer to Japanese silver coins.

sen.e: 1957: The 100-yen silver coin was issued.

sen.j: 1959年：百円銀貨のデザインが鳳凰から稲穂へ変更される。
sen.e: 1959: Design of The 100-yen silver coin was changed from hoo to ears of rice.
